Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: மறத்தல் வெகுளியை யார்மாட்டும் தீயபிறத்தல் அதனான் வரும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: If any rouse thy wrath, the trespass straight forget; For wrath an endless train of evils will beget.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown feeling a spark of anger ('வெகுளி') towards another.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Instead of nurturing it, they are shown actively 'forgetting' or extinguishing it ('மறத்தல்'). The spark of anger is snuffed out.
Layered_Composition.Background: A horrific vision of the alternative is shown. If the spark of anger were not extinguished, it would give birth ('பிறத்தல்') to a monstrous, endless brood of all other evils ('தீய'). A single spark of anger is shown birthing a horde of demons representing strife, hatred, violence, and sorrow.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: One must forget and extinguish anger instantly, no matter who causes it, because anger is the mother of all other evils.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: Anger as the single spark that gives birth to a horde of evil is the central metaphor. The act of 'forgetting' is an active quenching of this initial spark. The vision shows the catastrophic consequences of failing to do so.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The scene is dark. The initial spark of anger is a small but dangerous red. The act of quenching it brings peace. The vision of the alternative is a terrifying explosion of dark, monstrous shapes born from that single spark.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that focuses on the person's choice to extinguish the spark, with the horrific vision of what would happen otherwise looming large.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a terrifying and grotesque design for the 'brood of evils'.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The spark of anger is a potential source of a terrible, dark light.

Cultural_Anchors: All evils are born from it (தீய பிறத்தல் அதனான் வரும்)
